questions.question_text:
PCl5 dissociates as

PCl5(g) $$\rightleftharpoons$$ PCl3(g) + Cl2(g)

5 moles of PCl5 are placed in a 200 litre vessel which contains 2 moles of N2 and is maintained at 600 K. The equilibrium pressure is 2.46 atm. The equilibrium constant Kp for the dissociation of PCl5 is __________ $$\times$$ 10$$-$$3. (nearest integer)

(Given : R  = 0.082 L atm K$$-$$1 mol$$-$$1; Assume ideal gas behaviour)
questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question:
PCl_{5} dissociates as 
PCl_{5}(g) $$\rightleftharpoons$$ PCl_{3}(g) + Cl_{2}(g)

(Given : R  = 0.082 L atm K^{$$-$$1} mol^{$$-$$1}; Assume ideal gas behaviour)

questions.question: Two light beams of intensities in the ratio of 9 : 4 are allowed to interfere. The ratio of the intensity of maxima and minima will be :

questions.question_text: In Bohr's atomic model of hydrogen, let K, P and E are the kinetic energy, potential energy and total energy of the electron respectively. Choose the correct option when the electron undergoes transitions to a higher level :
questions.subject: Physics

options.A: All K, P and E increase.
options.B: K decreases, P and E increase.
options.C: P decreases, K and E increase.
options.D: K increases, P and E decrease.

questions.question: In Bohr's atomic model of hydrogen, let K, P and E are the kinetic energy, potential energy and total energy of the electron respectively. Choose the correct option when the electron undergoes transitions to a higher level :

questions.question_text: A body is projected from the ground at an angle of 45$$^\circ$$ with the horizontal. Its velocity after 2s is 20 ms$$-$$1. The maximum height reached by the body during its motion is __________ m. (use g = 10 ms$$-$$2)
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: A body is projected from the ground at an angle of 45$$^\circ$$ with the horizontal. Its velocity after 2s is 20 ms^{$$-$$1}. The maximum height reached by the body during its motion is __________ m. (use g = 10 ms^{$$-$$2})

questions.question_text:
Two travelling waves of equal amplitudes and equal frequencies move in opposite directions along a string. They interfere to produce a stationary wave whose equation is given by $$y = (10\cos \pi x\sin {{2\pi t} \over T})$$ cm

The amplitude of the particle at $$x = {4 \over 3}$$ cm will be ___________ cm.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question:
Two travelling waves of equal amplitudes and equal frequencies move in opposite directions along a string. They interfere to produce a stationary wave whose equation is given by $$y = (10\cos \pi x\sin {{2\pi t} \over T})$$ cm 
The amplitude of the particle at $$x = {4 \over 3}$$ cm will be ___________ cm.

questions.question_text: In the given circuit, the value of current IL will be ____________ mA. (When RL = 1k$$\Omega$$)
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: In the given circuit, the value of current I_{L} will be ____________ mA. (When R_{L} = 1k$$\Omega$$)

questions.question_text: A ray of light is incident at an angle of incidence 60$$^\circ$$ on the glass slab of refractive index $$\sqrt3$$. After refraction, the light ray emerges out from other parallel faces and lateral shift between incident ray and emergent ray is 4$$\sqrt3$$ cm. The thickness of the glass slab is __________ cm.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: A ray of light is incident at an angle of incidence 60$$^\circ$$ on the glass slab of refractive index $$\sqrt3$$. After refraction, the light ray emerges out from other parallel faces and lateral shift between incident ray and emergent ray is 4$$\sqrt3$$ cm. The thickness of the glass slab is __________ cm.

questions.question_text: A circular coil of 1000 turns each with area 1m2 is rotated about its vertical diameter at the rate of one revolution per second in a uniform horizontal magnetic field of 0.07T. The maximum voltage generation will be ___________ V.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: A circular coil of 1000 turns each with area 1m^{2} is rotated about its vertical diameter at the rate of one revolution per second in a uniform horizontal magnetic field of 0.07T. The maximum voltage generation will be ___________ V.

questions.question_text: A monoatomic gas performs a work of $${Q \over {4}}$$ where Q is the heat supplied to it. The molar heat capacity of the gas will be ______________ R during this transformation. Where R is the gas constant.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: A monoatomic gas performs a work of $${Q \over {4}}$$ where Q is the heat supplied to it. The molar heat capacity of the gas will be ______________ R during this transformation. Where R is the gas constant.
